document.hypothesis: Stocks with strong 12-month momentum excluding the most recent month exhibit continuation effect
document.findings: Statistically significant positive IC across market regimes. Works better in trending markets.
document.rationale: Classic momentum factor documented by Jegadeesh & Titman (1993)

document.hypothesis: Stocks with high earnings yield outperform over medium-term horizons
document.findings: Consistent positive spread across market cap quintiles
document.rationale: Fundamental value premium documented extensively in academic literature

document.hypothesis: Companies with consistently high ROE command premium valuations
document.findings: Strong performance in volatile markets, defensive characteristics
document.rationale: Quality factor captures sustainable competitive advantages

document.hypothesis: Low-beta stocks generate higher risk-adjusted returns than CAPM predicts
document.findings: Consistent outperformance on Sharpe basis, underperformance in strong bull markets
document.rationale: Betting against beta - leveraged investors bid up high-beta stocks

document.hypothesis: Small cap stocks outperform large caps over long horizons
document.findings: Strong in risk-on environments, underperforms in flight-to-quality
document.rationale: Size premium from Fama-French three-factor model

document.hypothesis: Stocks near 52-week highs continue to outperform due to anchoring bias
document.findings: Positive IC, stronger effect for stocks with fundamental support
document.rationale: George & Hwang (2004) - investors anchor to 52-week high

document.hypothesis: High book-to-market stocks are undervalued and mean-revert
document.findings: Classic value factor, struggled post-2010 but recovered recently

document.hypothesis: Gross profit to assets predicts stock returns better than net profitability
document.findings: Robust across market caps, less susceptible to accounting manipulation
document.rationale: Novy-Marx (2013) - gross profitability as quality measure

document.hypothesis: Stocks with extreme short-term returns mean-revert within 1 month
document.findings: High turnover but strong risk-adjusted returns, liquidity-constrained
document.rationale: Short-term overreaction to news, market microstructure effects

document.hypothesis: Firms with low asset growth outperform high asset growth firms
document.findings: Robust anomaly, potentially related to investment factor
document.rationale: Cooper, Gulen, Schill (2008) - asset growth effect
